title: Has the left gone too far? - Quora

response.answer_text: It would seem easy to say they have gone too far for people on the right or center, if in fact liberals for example are not in the center, which is debatable. But how this questions works best is by assuming a single and gradual continuum in the US say from left to right. I’m not sure this assumption works anymore. To me, there are now two main ideological camps, each with their own continuum. And you can only look at the left going too far relative to the left. In that instance, no, the progressives haven’t gone far enough, as several answers have suggested. The left is not leftist. It is about where Eisenhower Republicans were when I was a kid. If Bernie Sanders were the nominee, and if his democratic socialism were actually socialism, not reform capitalism, then that would be left. Liberalism is always too far for the right, even on the right edge of its continuum as the right is too far right even on its western edge. In my opinion this is a disaster for the country. And why? Democracy. We want our government to represent the people in its policies and executive decisions. But we don’t have enough consensus. Right now, liberals are being screwed. If there is a blue wave and an impeachment so that two branches of the government go left, conservatives will be getting screwed. That’s how they saw their almost decade under Obama, though he was as far right as liberalism could allow. In fact if one compared his foreign policy to Bush II, it was shockingly alike. Still, every proposal he made—actually Republican proposals—the Republicans in congress opposed. And why? They are not Republicans any more, they are partisans. Liberals are definitely not Democrats. They are just clinging to that party because…TRUMP! I don’t want anybody to be screwed in this country. These people are my fellow-Americans and they should act like it. If you don’t run on a bi-partisan ticket you shouldn’t run. You shouldn’t be able to win primaries. But where the parties are not parties, but partisans, that will never happen. What the hell kind of democracy can we have when their is no The People but those over there, and these over here?

Yes, without a doubt the left has gone too far. How can we tell the left has gone too far? The left is now: denying basic biology (“transgender women are women”)enforcing speech upon people (“use my pronouns or get arrested in Canada or banned from university campuses or fired”)shutting down free speech and debate (“no platforming” and the violence of Antifa)labeling anyone that disagrees with them (“hate speech” which basically means “I disagree with this!”)inciting violence against anyone they disagree with (“it’s okay to punch a Nazi - or anyone I think might be a Nazi because I disagree with them”)censoring opinions across the internet (being banned from Twitter and / or Facebook is beginning to be a badge of honor for anyone from the right).The list goes on. Remember when it was the right wing that was banning and censoring free speech and dissenting views? I do. It’s only a few short years ago. It’s not that long ago that Al Gore’s “An Inconvenient Truth” was banned in cinemas across the Bible Belt (and beyond), and Harry Potter movies were banned in cinemas too. Remember Harry Potter books being banned in schools and burned on pyres because they promoted “witchcraft”? It’s not that long ago. Or have you forgotten all that? Other books - including Catch-22, The Decameron, Elmer Gantry, Fanny Hill, Forever Amber, The Grapes of Wrath and many others were also banned in the US in the past. It was all the doing of the right. The left wing criticized those that censored and banned and argued for free speech - and rightly so. Yet now it’s the left wing doing the banning, the censorship, the “edits and undoes” on Wikipedia, and the religious-fervor downvotes and bans on Quora. Yes, the left has become the “bad guys” - and hasn’t even noticed it has done so! The wheel has turned full circle, the snake is eating its tail, and the left hasn’t yet even noticed. Everyone else has, and we’re paralyzed with fear of where this all might lead, yet the extreme left keeps on banning, censoring and slapping “hate speech” labels on everything and everyone that doesn’t agree with their articular point of view. This is what happens when the left goes too far. In trying to appease everyone and keep people’s feelings from getting hurt, it has stifled free speech and free thought, and even fundamental biological facts, the very foundations of the Enlightenment and modern thought. Any speech the left disagrees with (probably including this post!) has become “hate speech” and is being lined up for banning, censoring, and editing out of existence, down Orwell’s memory hole and into the flames of non-existence. Well done.

Absolutely. This is why you have Trump. No further explanation is necessary, but I'll elaborate. If you look at progressive ballot initiatives, you'll see that in nearly every case, their initiatives fail. Marriage equality, transgender normalization, don't ask/don't tell, gun control, etc. all fail without court intervention. $15 minimum wage fails a popular vote and must be imposed by political will. So the people-en mass- generally don't agree with them. They aren't admired, there is no SJW John Wayne. Fox news has more viewers than any other network-in fact ALL of the other networks. What's the most popular show on TV? 1.The Big Bang Theory (18.4 million)2.NBC NFL Sunday Football (18.2 million)3.Roseanne (17.6 million)4.This is Us (17.4 million)5.NCIS (16.7 million)6.Young Sheldon (16.0 million)7.The Good Doctor (15.6 million)8.Bull (14.5 million)9.CBS Thursday Football (14.2 million)10.NBC Thursday Football (13.5 million) How many of those do you think have more or less progressive themes? What movies are popular? Was it Star Wars or an Inconvenient Truth? We are a conservative nation, our people are conservative and espouse conservative values. Any progressive movement is accomplished by force. At some point, the left will have pushed too far and the right will feel forced to push back and it's not likely to be very pretty or civil when it happens.

Yes! Today, mainstream Democrats are largely Rockefeller Republicans. The Rockefeller Republicans were more liberal on social issues than the Republican Party in general of their time. Since then, the social views of the religious right have been adopted into mainstream Republicanism, pushing that party very far right. On economics, neoliberalism (the laissez-faire economics typical of the Republican Party of last century) is the mainstream Democratic Party position and has been since Bill Clinton won the Presidency. The social and economic positions of the current Democratic Party put them squarely in the Rockefeller Republican camp. The Democratic Party may seem like “the left” today, but only because it is to the left of a Republican Party that has shifted far right. The number of people who would be truly on the left in the US is miniscule. The slightly larger number of people who hold center-left views (still a very small minority) are not well represented by any party. They are stuck allying themselves with a center-right Democratic Party because (1) there is no viable center-left party, and (2) Americans, in general, tend to shift right when the choice they are presented is between two candidates, one of whom is to their left and one of whom is to their right. The upshot is that those who are center-left wind up supporting center-right Democrats in elections. So, yes, “the left” in the United States has gone too far — too far to the right.

If you’re speaking of the American left, the clear answer is that leftists are not progressive. They’re conservative. Both the left and right are largely capitalistic, something unlike any other major developed country. For example, universal healthcare is usually agreed upon by leftists and rightists in developed countries. In America, it’s seen as a radical system. In Canada, it’s seen as an unalienable right. The biggest difference between the left and right in America are the social issues. This is where I’d argue that the right has gone too far. Rightist America has always advocating for the stalling of social equality, from slavery to police brutality. Rightists tend to be against the advocation of equity and diversity, despite the research done on the subject showing that we need this. If there’s one thing where I believe that leftists have gone too far, it’s cancel culture. Nothing is accomplished by calling those of opposing social opinions as racist or unethical. Cancel culture only encourages people of differing views to hide their opinions from the world. If people want to be effective, they should be willing to accept people for who they are, despite their beliefs, even if their beliefs may be unethical. This will create a society that builds upon each other, and will help people learn and grow.

Most certainly, the make accusations against our commander in chief without any real facts, they have attacked and spit at our nations law enforcement for doing thier job? Look I have gotten my fair share of tickets and BS from the police but I have always understood and respected their sacrifices , the rule of law is necessary to stability. Spitting on cops and throwing trash on them because you dont want to pay a subway fair? Animals like that do not belong in our great nation. The left would see a world without freedom, they constantly attack our 1st,2nd,4th amendments and like spoiled little rich boys they dont know how to take thier ball and go home. I thought Obama was a awful president, he did nothing for 8 years but he won and i accepted him as president. You left wingers have failed to accept trump and the more you try and villainize him the bigger fools you look like. Middle class working Americans are sick and tired of these fanatics and you should all just go to New Zealand or one of the many countries that have no rights, bottom line if you dont like it here you do have the Freedom! To leave!

Well, let’s look at the question for a logical reference point… We know “the Right” has escaped a plane of reality, sanity, morals, and ethics… Right? So…. has the Left (liberals and Progressives?) done the same? No…. BUT- If you want to ONLY look at “the beliefs of the Righties”, then decades of brainwashing of: “Lefties being Commies, Pro-Crime, and anti-God baby-killers”… then of COURSE “lefties” will ALWAYS have gone too far… Fortunately we have reality where we KNOW that Righties, and the GOP are taking Commie Russian Mafia money, refusing to investigate Commie Mafia hacking of elections, and Commie Mafia Changing of Votes in America, and voting AGAINST helping the poor and sick (including letting children die), which is God’s #1 Principle… (unless making MORE POOR PEOPLE and MAKING THEM DIE FASTER is Pro-religion now… It’s ALWAYS been a conservative effect of their policies) Did I go to far?

If one side stands still and the other moves far to the right, who has really gone too far? I’m a moderate Republican. Today’s ‘average’ Republican has me scratching my head. My party is doing unbelievable harm in my name, blaming the Democrats and then calling themselves the ‘party of personal responsibility.’ It’s downright surreal. Barry Goldwater once famously predicted: “Mark my word, if and when these preachers get control of the [Republican] party, and they're sure trying to do so, it's going to be a terrible damn problem. Frankly, these people frighten me. Politics and governing demand compromise. But these Christians believe they are acting in the name of God, so they can't and won't compromise. I know, I've tried to deal with them.” Chillingly accurate.

I am a leftist and agree with the replies that state the US is not left enough politically as far as health care, separation of church and state, civil rights, and so on. However, it does seem that some segments of society have seized control of parts of the equal rights narrative and exploited it for very un-leftist authoritarian purposes. Whether this is really the left going “too far” or someone else hijacking the agenda for tyranny, I leave that up to readers making their own opinion. My point is that many on the right the right are using these events to demonize the left because of the professed objectives and language being used by the hijackers.

Remember that ‘the left’ is a very broad thing made up of people and groups who have widely varying views on all of these things. It may be true that a vocal subset of the left has gone too far (just as a vocal subset of the right has not improved), but I am most definitely on the left and these examples of the views said to be held by ‘the left’ do not represent me or many of my comrades. For example, I do not accuse those who disagree with me of hate speech unless they are actually engaging in hate speech - most of the people I know, even those whose political views are entirely at odds with mine, are decent people who are perfectly capable of disagreeing in a reasonable and repectful manner.

There are plenty of good answers. I couldn’t add anything of value, so instead I will use this space to say, you might want to travel, if you can. Looking at many of your questions, you might be in a rut, gazing up to the sky, hoping for a change. That is a good inclination, in my experience. Sometimes we just get too plugged in to one situation, one crowd, one routine. It can artificially emphasize some thoughts and mute others. It limits you, like a fixed diet. I know free advice is worth just as much as it costs. Still, my advice would be, go until you dine on something exotic.

Has the left gone too far? The right has gone too far, the left has not gone far enough. Trump demonstrates that the right went too far. The GOP will never recover from the giant infant’s damage to both the nation, and the GOP’s reputation. The popularity of Bernie Sanders, and how the DNC treated him, show that the left has not gone far enough. We are now demanding the kind of changes he recommends, things that were believed to be fringe just a few years ago.

It’s hard to find anyone on the left, even in Ann Arbor, MI. A pallid centrist is the best you’re likely to find. Obama was a center-right sort of candidate. Obamacare was Romneycare, and he was a right wing candidate. The rest of the GOP has gone howling off to the extreme right for decades. They don’t even recognize their own now. One of their own, Ronald Reagan, has been labeled a RINO (Republican In Name Only.)
In the USA, the left practically doesn’t exist. The right has gone way too far.

response.answer_text: The “establishment" has gona too far. The Bernie wing on the other hand hasn't. They are the only rational people in the US. In some countroes, the left have some policies that are crazy.

Yes and so has the right. I blame us, because we’ve voted for “news entertainment” over “news” with our TV remotes. If you listen to any podcast in the intellectual dark web you will come away better informed. If you watch any TV news you will come away less informed.

This is intentionally vague and unknowable and unanswerable. Anyone who claims to have an answer to this is pushing an agenda in one direction or another. The same question could be posed as “Has the right gone too far?” and would be equally as unknowable and unanswerable. This is pure opinion baiting and echo chambering and biased questioning.

My theory is the right becomes dangerous when a political narrative is formed around collective superiority. The left becomes dangerous when a political narrative is formed around collective oppression. Both extreme left and right actors become possessed with an unscientific ideology which leads to catastrophic initiatives undertaken to support their world view.
